Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the Virtual Machine Scale Sets, including the expected workload, scaling policies, instance types, and regions.
Design the architecture for the Virtual Machine Scale Sets, including network configurations, load balancing, and integration with other Azure services.

Tasks.Task: Select VM Image and Instance Type
Tasks.Task Description: Choose the appropriate VM image and instance type based on workload requirements and cost considerations.
Define and configure scaling policies, including auto-scaling rules based on metrics like CPU usage, memory, or custom metrics.
Apply security best practices, such as enabling encryption for VM disks, configuring Network Security Groups (NSGs), and setting up Azure Defender.
Deploy the Virtual Machine Scale Sets using Azure Portal, CLI, or ARM templates. Verify deployment success.
Set up and configure an Azure Load Balancer to distribute traffic across the Virtual Machine Scale Sets.
Configure monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor to track performance metrics, scaling events, and VM health.
Perform tests to validate scaling policies and failover mechanisms. Ensure the system scales up and down as expected under load.
Create detailed documentation for the Virtual Machine Scale Sets setup, including architecture diagrams, scaling policies, and operational procedures.
Train the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Virtual Machine Scale Sets, including scaling policies and monitoring tools.
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with security policies and operational standards.
